intro: Kleinia cacalioides, commonly known as the Cape marigold, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow to orange flowers that bloom in dense, showy clusters. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its foliage consists of narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white wax. Kleinia cacalioides is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
